sen.j: 13世紀以降は、鎌倉時代、南北朝時代 (日本)、室町時代を通じて、大和民族の分布域は、北海道の渡島半島南部に定着した（渡党を参照）程度で、拡大は停滞した。
sen.e: After the 13th century, throughout Kamakura period, the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) and Muromachi Period, the distribution range of Yamato race was setting back in expansion, only settling in Oshima Peninsula in Hokkaido (refer to Watari-to).

sen.j: だが、独特の文化が国風文化として花開き、現在まで続く日本の文化もこの流れを汲むものが多い。
sen.e: However, the peculiar culture turned into Kokufu Bunka (indigenous Japanese culture) and many Japanese culture still existing now follow it.
However, the peculiar culture blossomed into Kokufu Bunka (indigenous Japanese culture) and many aspects of Japanese culture which still exist now come from it.

sen.j: この状況が一時的に崩れるのは戦国時代 (日本)であり、大和民族は日本人として世界各国と貿易するようになり、これまでの価値観とは全く異なるものに触れるようになる。
sen.e: In the Sengoku period the situation changed temporarily as Yamato race began trading with foreign countries as Japanese, being exposed to something different from traditional sense of value.
In the Sengoku period, the situation changed temporarily as the Yamato race began trading with foreign countries as Japanese, being exposed to something different from their traditional values.

sen.j: キリスト教が伝来して信者を集め、鉄砲などの最新技術が瞬く間に全国へと普及した。
sen.e: Christianity was introduced, gathering the devotees, and newest technology such as gun spread around the country instantly.

sen.j: また、移民としても進出し、東南アジアではアユタヤ日本人町のように一定の基盤を持つ社会を構成した。
sen.e: They also moved out as immigrants, building societies which have a certain basis such as Ayutaya Japanese town in Southeast Asia.
They also immigrated away from Japan, building societies with a standardized basis, such as Ayutaya Japanese town in Southeast Asia.

sen.j: さらには、支倉常長などのように遠くヨーロッパにも渡った者もいたが、これら海外への拡大の動きは江戸幕府の鎖国政策によって衰退することとなる。
sen.e: And there were people who went as far as to Europe like Tsunenaga HASEKURA, however, the expansion movement to foreign countries began to decline due to the seclution policy of Edo bakufu.

sen.j: 江戸時代は鎖国と呼ばれる状態にあり、外国との交流は中国（明・清）やオランダなどを除いて断絶したが、250年に亘る「泰平」を築いた。
sen.e: In Edo period, Japan was in the state of what is called national isolation, ending the Cultural exchanges with foreign countries except China (Ming, Qing) and the Netherlands, establishing peace continuing 250 years instead.

In the Edo period, Japan was in a state of what is called national isolation, ending cultural exchanges with foreign countries except for China (Ming, Qing) and the Netherlands, establishing peace which continued for 250 years instead.

sen.j: この間、社会は幕府の強大な支配に置かれたが、逆に言えば安定した社会が築かれ、経済活動が活発化して庶民が台頭、町人文化が花開いた。
sen.e: During which, the society was put under the great power of Bakufu, yet, a stable society was established, economics was activated, the common people emerged, and the townsmen culture was founded.

During this time, society was put under the great power of Bakufu; however, a stable society was established, the economy was stimulated, the common people rose in stature, and mercantile culture bloomed.

sen.j: 元禄文化や化政文化が発展し、現在は海外でも有名な日本的な物とされる文物の多くが作られた。
sen.e: Genroku Culture and Kasei cultures were developed and most of the products of culture which are now appreciated as popular Japanese products also in foreign country were made.
Genroku Culture and Kasei cultures were developed and most of the aspects of culture which are now appreciated as popular Japanese products abroad as well as nationally came into being.

sen.j: また、薩摩藩による琉球王国制圧が起こり、王国は事実上幕藩体制の支配下へと組み込まれた。
sen.e: And the subjugation of The Ryukyu Kingdom by Satsuma Province occurred, putting it under the control of shogunate system virtually.
The subjugation of the Ryukyu Kingdom by Satsuma Province also took place, putting it under the virtual control of the shogunate system.

sen.j: 蝦夷地（現在の北海道）での勢力も増していき、渡島半島南部は内地化し、北海道全域が大和民族の勢力下に置かれるようになった（アイヌ等を参照）。
sen.e: Yamato race's power was increased also in Ezochi (inhabited area of Ainu), turning southern Oshima Peninsula into inland, and whole area of Hokkaido was became under the power of Yamato race (refer to Ainu tribe and others).

The Yamato race's power also increased in Ezochi (inhabited area of Ainu), turning the southern Oshima Peninsula into part of the inland, and the whole area of Hokkaido came under the power of the Yamato race (refer to Ainu tribe and others).

sen.j: 明治維新によって新時代を迎えると、それまでの鎖国を取りやめ、海外と積極的に関わる「開国」の時代に入る。
sen.e: After getting into new era by Meiji Restoration, Japan ended national isolation and the era of opening of a country to the world in which Japan related with foreign countries positively began.

After entering a new era with the Meiji Restoration, Japan ended its national isolation and began the era of opening the country to the world, in which Japan began relations with foreign countries positively.

After entering a new era with the Meiji Restoration, Japan ended its national isolation and began the era of opening the country to the world, in which Japan began relations with foreign countries positively.

sen.j: 近代国家として大日本帝国を成立させた。
sen.e: Empire of Japan was established as a modern state.
The Empire of Japan was established as a modern state.
The Empire of Japan was established as a modern state.

sen.j: 帝国は、強大な西洋諸国に対抗する形で各国に経済的・軍事的に進出していった。
sen.e: The empire was moving out in economical and military way to oppose the powerful Western countries.
The empire was expanding both economically and militarily in order to oppose powerful Western countries.
The empire was expanding both economically and militarily in order to oppose powerful Western countries.

sen.j: また対外的にも、琉球列島や小笠原諸島、千島列島や樺太といった列島の諸島の領有を確立し、現在の日本の領土をほぼ確定させた。
sen.e: And externally, the possession of the islands such as Ryukyu Islands, Ogasawara Islands (Bonin Islands), Kurile Islands and Sakhalin was established, almost settling today's Japanese territory.

Meanwhile, externally, the possession of islands, such as the Ryukyu Islands, Ogasawara Islands (Bonin Islands), Kurile Islands and Sakhalin was established, nearly settling the present territory of Japan.

sen.j: 他に、国策として海外への移民を奨励して、ブラジルやアメリカ合衆国、ペルー、カナダ、ハワイ、メキシコ、アルゼンチン、パラグアイなどに多数の移民が渡った。
sen.e: Other than that, the empire encouraged the emigration to foreign countries as national policy, sending many immigrants to Brazil, the United States of America, Peru, Canada, Hawaii, Mexico, Argentina, Paraguay and others.

sen.j: 日清戦争・日露戦争や第一次世界大戦で世界の列強と渡り合い、勝利した。
sen.e: Japan won Japanese-Sino War, Japanese-Russo War and First World War, fighting against powerful countries around the world.
Japan won the Japanese-Sino War, Japanese-Russo War and the First World War, fighting against powerful countries around the world.

sen.j: 結果、台湾を領有、大韓帝国を韓国併合、満州国を建国、南洋諸島を委任統治とするなど、アジア・オセアニア各地に急速に分布域を広げたために多民族国家となった。
sen.e: In the result, Japan became multiracial nation due to a rapidly expanded distribution range to various regions of Asia and Oceania, possessing Korea, annexating The Korean Empire, building Manchukuo, putting the South Sea Islands under mandate.

As a result, Japan became a multiracial nation due to a rapidly expanded range of settlement over various regions of Asia and Oceania, possessing Korea, annexing the Korean Empire, building Manchukuo, and putting the South Sea Islands under mandate.

sen.j: 現地の住民との大小の衝突、時には反乱を起こされながらも、着実に支配を固め、社会基盤を築いていった。
sen.e: Japan had built a social basis, cementing its grip steadily while having big or small conflict between local resident or being rebelled sometimes.
Japan built the bases of a society, steadily cementing its grip while dealing with various levels of conflicts with local residents or sometimes being rebelled against.

sen.j: 国際連盟の常任理事国にもなり、国際的地位も高まった。
sen.e: Its international status rose, obtaining a permanent seat in League of Nations.

sen.j: この過程で、台湾や朝鮮から日本列島への他の民族の流入もおこった。
sen.e: During which, other races came into the Japanese archipelago from Taiwan and Korea.
During this time, other races came into the Japanese archipelago from Taiwan and Korea.

sen.j: さらに、第二次世界大戦においては大東亜共栄圏の行動を打ち出し、当時イギリスやオランダなどの列強が植民地化していた東南アジアに進軍し、欧米の占領軍を追い出して後釜に座る形でほぼ全域を占領、あるいは影響下に置いた。
sen.e: And in the World War II, Japan proposed the action of the Great East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere, marched into Southeast Asia which was the colony of powerful countries such as England and the Netherlands, casting out the Occupation Forces of Europe and America and took their places occupying or putting under the influence almost the whole area.

sen.j: この状況は、第二次世界大戦に敗北した事によって終わりを告げる。
sen.e: Such situation ended when Japan lost the World War II.
This situation ended when Japan was defeated in World War II.

sen.j: 列島周辺の主権を失ったために、各地に移住していた日本人の大概は、引揚者として日本に引き揚げていった。
sen.e: Japanese who had migrated to various places returned to Japan as repatriates since Japan lost sovereign power on the countries around the archipelago.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦後は平和国家として再出発し、アメリカ合衆国の軍事的な保護の元、急激に海外文化（主にアメリカ文化）を吸収して経済発展を成し遂げた（神武景気等）。
sen.e: After the World War II, Japan started out as a peaceful country and achieved economic development (Jimmu Boom and others), assimilating foreign cultures (mainly American one) rapidly under the military protection of America.

sen.j: 最近では日本国の国力が世界有数になったため、国策としての海外移民は行われず、集団での移民も見られなくなっている。
sen.e: These days, migration to foreign countries as national policy is not conducted and so is a group migration, since Japanese has become one of the world's top countries having great national powers.

sen.j: 逆に近年では、高齢化社会の影響から移民の受け入れを唱える主張も一部には出てきている。
sen.e: However, in recent years, the insistence of accepting immigrants is rising due to an aging society.
